headline: Ask HN: BeReal Shows Who Takes Screenshots with No Notice to Users
description:
I've been enjoying BeReal recently, the new social media app that promises to not waste your time and encourages authentic expression. Most of human life is boring, ugly, and unfiltered, which is exactly what I see in my BeReal feed.

However, I think it is pretty sketchy of BeReal to not tell people about screenshot notifications. It turns out that if you take screenshots of BeReal photos, that person can see that you did it. It can be embarrassing to save someone's photo, on purpose or accidentally, and not realize that they will find out. There's no warning or confirmation process, so you might take a screenshot without realizing that someone else will know. The developers haven't written a blog post on this topic, don't mention this in their "Warnings" in the app store, and haven't answered open Reddit threads even though they clearly included this feature as a growth hack.

I think that BeReal should tell users explicitly that if you take screenshots, the person will know and see who you are. I believe this because I think your behavior in an app should be considered private unless explicitly stated otherwise. What do you think?
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: BeReal显示谁在不通知用户的情况下进行截图
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: BeReal顯示誰在不通知用戶的情況下進行截圖
description_zh-Hans:
我最近很喜欢BeReal，这个新的社交媒体应用程序承诺不浪费你的时间，并鼓励真实表达。 人类生活的大部分都是无聊、丑陋和未经过滤的，这正是我在BeReal feed中看到的。

然而，我认为BeReal不告诉人们关于截图通知的做法是相当粗略的。事实证明，如果你对BeReal的照片进行截图，那个人就可以看到你做了什么。故意或意外地保存某人的照片，而没有意识到他们会发现，这可能是很尴尬的。没有警告或确认过程，所以你可能在没有意识到别人会知道的情况下进行了截图。开发者没有就这个话题写过一篇博文，在应用商店的"警告"中也没有提到这一点，也没有回答公开的Reddit线程，尽管他们明确将这个功能作为一个增长黑客。

我认为，BeReal应该明确告诉用户，如果你截图，对方会知道并看到你是谁。我相信这一点，因为我认为你在一个应用程序中的行为应该被视为隐私，除非有明确的规定。你怎么看？
